Description: THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE NATIVE AMERICAN ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION COALITION (NAEPC) TO HIRE AND TRAIN A UST INSPECTOR(S) WHO WILL BE QUALIFIED TO OBTAIN A FEDERAL USEPA CREDENTIAL. THIS INSPECTOR WILL CONDUCT COMPLIANCE AND OUTREACH INSPECTIONS ON BEHALF OF THE USEPA FOR TRIBES THAT HAVE JOINED INTO AGREEMENTS WITH NAEPC TO HAVE ITS INSPECTOR COME TO THEIR TRIBAL LANDS TO CONDUCT UST INSPECTIONS.   THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $58,678.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE'S UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM IN LEAK DETECTION, PREVENTION AND RELATED ENFORCEMENT. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE: ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS; ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS; AND DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $400,000.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE ILLINOIS STATE FIRE MARSHAL OFFICE IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM.  THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE: (1) ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKSAND (2) ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONSAND AND (3) DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.  THESE OBJECTIVES PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT BY PREVENTING PETROLEUM AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE RELEASES.  THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO IMPROVE COMPLIANCE THROUGH ACTIVE INSPECTIONS, ENFORCEMENT, AND COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS.  THIS FUNDING IS ALSO TO BE USED FOR RELEASE DETECTION AND PREVENTION ACTIVITIES TO COMPLY WITH THE ENERGY POLICY ACT OF 2005.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS TO INCREASE PERCENTAGE OF UST FACILITIES THAT ARE IN SIGNIFICANT OPERATIONAL COMPLIANCE WITH BOTH RELEASE DETECTION AND RELEASE PREVENTION BY 5% COMPARED TO 2006 OUT OF A TOTAL ESTIMATED UNIVERSE OF 6,216 ACTIVE FACILITIES IN THE STATEAND AUTHORITIES AND REGULATIONS FOR THE STATE UST PROGRAM IN ORDER TO MEET FEDERAL STANDARDS, AND DEVELOP AND PUBLISH OPERATOR TRAINING REQUIREMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH EPA GUIDELINES.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY AND OFFICE OF THE STATE FIRE MARSHALL WILL PROVIDE FUNDING OF ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE CONDUCTING THE ADMINISTRATION OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS SITES WITHIN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS. THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LUST PREVENTION PROGRAM INCLUDE ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR USTS, ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR USTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH REGULATIONS, AND DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.   
ACTIVITIES:LUST PREVENTION PROGRAMS INCLUDE INSPECTIONS AND OTHER ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES, OPERATOR TRAINING, SECONDARY CONTAINMENT SUPPORT ACTIVITIES, DELIVERY PROHIBITION ACTIVITIES, AND PUBLIC REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THE APPLICANT'S WORKPLAN INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: EPACT IMPLEMENTATION, COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT, AND TRAINING. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTING AND COMPLIANCE RATE REPORTING.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS THE NUMBER OF INSPECTIONS COMPLETED OF THE TANKS IN THE STATE OF NORTH DAKOTA.  

THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STATE UST PROGRAM AND STATE RESIDENTS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STANDING ROCK SIOUX TRIBE TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE RESERVATION. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SAMPLING, OUTREACH AND EDUCATION AND DATA ANALYSIS.

&BULLAND	THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO BUILD AND SUSTAIN THE ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY OF THE STANDING ROCK SIOUX TRIBE AND TO MONITOR AND ASSESS WATER QUALITY ON THE STANDING ROCK RESERVATION.
&BULLAND	ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ON THE STANDING ROCK RESERVATION, TRAINING OF DEPARTMENT STAFF, SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS OF TRIBAL WATERS, DATA MANAGEMENT, ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION, DATA QUALITY CONTROL AND GRANTS MANAGEMENT AND ACCOUNTING.}
&BULLAND	ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS TO THE EPA, THE APPROPRIATE AND EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF EPA FUNDING, AND MEASURES TO IMPROVE AND PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.
&BULLAND	THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STANDING ROCK RESERVATION.
&BULLAND	NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ARE ANTICIPATED AT THE TIME OF THE AWARD.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $700,000 TO THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (FDEP). THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF FDEPS UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM IN LEAK DETECTION, PREVENTION AND RELATED ENFORCEMENT.  THE OBJECTIVES OF THE UST PROGRAM ARE: (1) ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR USTS; (2) ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR USTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS; AND (3) DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:THIS EPA GRANT ENTAILS (1) IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF THE INFORMATION IN THE UST/LUST DATABASE AND GATHERED VIA THE INSPECTION; (2) MAINTAINING AN OPERATOR TRAINING PROGRAM BY THE UTILIZING THE ONLINE OPERATOR TRAINING PROGRAM TANKHELPER; (3) THE PROGRAM EVALUATING UST COMPLIANCE ISSUES ON-SITE WITH UST OWNERS AND OPERATORS THROUGH INSPECTIONS, OBSERVING UST CLOSURES AND OBSERVING INSTALLATIONS; AND (4) ENSURING ALL SPA REQUIREMENTS PER THE MOA ARE BEING FOLLOWED. THE PROGRAM WILL WORK WITH EPA ON SCHEDULING OVERSIGHT ACTIVITIES.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  (1) MAINTAIN UST DATABASE INCLUDING NEW INFORMATION AND ROUTINE UPDATES, (2) SUBMIT SEMI-ANNUAL AND ANNUAL PROGRAM REPORTS TO EPA , (3) ENSURE ALL OPERATORS ARE TRAINED WITHIN 30 DAYS OF ASSUMING RESPONSIBILITY, (4) CONDUCT APPROXIMATELY 200 UST INSPECTIONS,  (5) PREPARE ANY EPA REQUESTED REPORTS RELATED TO SPA OVERSIGHT, INCLUDING INSPECTION OVERSIGHT,SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES:  (1) MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE DATABASE, (2) COMPILE AND SUBMIT ENERGY ACT PROGRAM REPORTS TO EPA.  ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES: 1) OPERATOR TRAINING REPORT VERIFYING TRAINED CLASS A/B OPERATORS; 2) INSPECTION REPORT, INCLUDING EXPLANATION OF PAST-DUE INSPECTIONS; 3) ENFORCEMENT STATISTICS REPORT DEPICTING TYPES OF ENFORCEMENT ISSUED AND RETURN TO COMPLIANCE DATES; 4) COMPLIANCE (SOC) REPORT; 5) COMMON VIOLATIONS REPORT; AND 6) PUBLIC RECORD REPORT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF IDAHO IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM. THE DATABASE PROVIDES THE PUBLIC WITH THE INFORMATION THEY NEED TO MAKE DECISIONS REGARDING PROPERTY TRANSACTIONS OR TO SEE WHAT POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONTAMINATION SOURCES ARE IN THEIR COMMUNITY. THE DATABASE PROVIDES STAFF AND EPA WITH INFORMATION ON COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT.  ENSURE THE PROGRAM IS MEETING THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE WORK PLAN BY PREPARING REPORTS AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES FOR BOTH EPA AND DEQ MANAGEMENT.  ATTEND AND HOST MEETINGS TO GAIN KNOWLEDGE AND SHARE IDEAS. MEETINGS ARE NECESSARY TO: (1) LEARN FROM STATE AND FEDERAL COUNTERPARTS ON HOW TO MEET PROGRAM CHALLENGES WITH LIMITED FUNDING SOURCES; (2) SHARE PROGRAM ACCOMPLISHMENTS; (3) TO IDENTIFY ISSUES REQUIRING FURTHER ATTENTION; AND (4) TO FACILITATE DISCUSSION OF ON-GOING UST ISSUES AND TO PLAN FUTURE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. MEET WITH OR ASK TECHNICAL QUESTIONS TO EPA REGION 10 AND/OR EPA HEADQUARTERS REGARDING REGULATION INTERPRETATION OR POLICY DIRECTION SO THE PROGRAM CAN PROVIDE THE PUBLIC WITH ACCURATE INFORMATION.  BASED ON THE STATE'S STATUTE, RULES, AND SPA MOA WITH EPA, STAFF WILL PERFORM ON-SITE UST INSPECTIONS. IDAHO HAS 1,200 FACILITIES WHICH EQUATES TO 400 INSPECTIONS PER YEAR UTILIZING FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDING.  PROVIDE UST INFORMATION, RECORDS, AND REPORTS TO USER GROUPS (E.G. OTHER AGENCIES, GENERAL PUBLIC, REGULATED COMMUNITY, FINANCIAL AND PROPERTY TRANSFER INSTITUTIONS, INTEREST GROUPS, LEGISLATURE) CONCERNING INSTALLATIONS, CLOSURES, UPGRADES, AND ALL OTHER UST ISSUES. THESE RESULTS SUPPORT THE EPA'S STRATEGIC PLAN GOAL TO SAFEGUARD AND REVITALIZE COMMUNITIES, AND THE OBJECTIVE TO REDUCE OR PREVENT ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINATION. THE FOCUS OF THIS UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM IS LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PREVENTION AND PREVENTING THE OCCURRENCE OF NEW LUST SITES IN INDIAN COUNTRY.  TASKS TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THE GRANT INCLUDE EMPLOYEE TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, PERFORMING  INSPECTIONS, OWNER/OPERATOR TRAINING, ESTABLISHING A GIS DATABASE WITH TANK INFORMATION, OVERSEEING TANK CLOSURES, PARTICIPATE IN NATIONAL INDIAN COUNTRY UST/LUST WORKGROUPS, AND OTHER UST RELATED SERVICES.

THE STATE OF WASHINGTON IS UNDERTAKING THE FOLLOWING ACITIVITIES: (1) CONDUCT INSPECTIONS ON A 3 YEAR INSPECTION CYCLE FOR ALL UST SITES AND PROVIDE FOR COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES TO DEAL WITH VIOLATIONS; (2) PROVIDE FOR A COORDINATIVE FUNCTION WITHIN THE UST PROGRAM; (3) REPORT VARIOUS REQUIRED ACTIVITES TO EPA; (4) EVALUATE AND VERIFIY COMPLIANCE WITH OPERATOR TRAINING PROGRAM DURING AN UST INSPECTION; AND (5) CONTINUE TO UPDATE PUBLIC RECORD AS REQUIRED UNDER USTCA.

THE STATE OF WASHINGTON IS UNDERTAKING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: 1) WORK ON UPDATING THE STATE UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK RULES TO MATCH THE REVISED FEDERAL UST RULES. 2) PROVIDE TRAVEL TO STAFF TO ATTEND EPA'S ADVACNED INSPECTOR TRAINING.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO EIGHT NORTHERN INDIAN PUEBLOS COUNCIL (ENIPC) TO SUPPORT THEIR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM. SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE EIGHT NORTHERN INDIAN PUEBLO COUNCIL'S (ENIPC'S) LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PREVENTION PROGRAM WITH TWENTY-ONE TRIBES/PUEBLOS IN NEW MEXICO, WHICH INCLUDES COMPLIANCE MONITORING, FACILITY COMPLIANCE TRAINING, LEAK DETECTION, PREVENTION, AND RELATED ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES.

THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TAN (LUST) PREVENTION PROGRAM INCLUDE: ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (USTS), ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (USTS) IN ACCORDANCE WITH REGULATIONS, AND DEVELOPING THE TRIBAL PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.   
ACTIVITIES:LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PREVENTION PROGRAMS INCLUDE INSPECTIONS AND OTHER COMPLIANCE RELATED ACTIVITIES, OPERATOR TRAINING, SECONDARY CONTAINMENT SUPPORT ACTIVITIES, DELIVERY PROHIBITION ACTIVITIES, AND PUBLIC REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THE WORKPLAN ELEMENTS INCLUDE COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE VISITS TO UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) FACILITIES IN NEW MEXICO INDIAN COUNTRY. SPECIFIC ELEMENTS INCLUDE, BUT ARE LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING: 1)UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) COMPLIANCE TRAINING TO OWNERS/OPERATORS AND PERSONNEL DIRECTLY RESPONSIBLE FOR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) OPERATIONS; 2) COMPLIANCE MONITORING AND REPORTING COMPLIANCE PERFORMANCE CONSISTENT WITH NATIONAL TECHNICAL COMPLIANCE RATE; 3) ASSIST TRIBES/PUEBLOS WITH INPUT TO THE TRIBAL COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.

NOTE:  LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PREVENTION APPROPRIATIONS USED IN THIS AGREEMENT MAY BE USED TO SUPPORT ANY ACTIONS NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT THE UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PREVENTION PROGRAM, AS HIGHLIGHTED IN EPA'S STRATEGY FOR AN EPA/TRIBAL PARTNERSHIP TO IMPLEMENT SECTION 1529 OF THE ENERGY POLICY ACT OF 2005.  
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE TRIBAL UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) OWNER/ OPERATOR COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE TO TWENTY ONE NEW MEXICO TRIBES/ PUEBLOS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS THE NUMBER OF COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE AND REPORTING COMPLETED OF THE TANKS IN THE TRIBAL LANDS OF NEW MEXICO.  

THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES ARE THE TRIBE/ PUEBLOS' UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAMS AND TRIBAL RESIDENTS IN NEW MEXICO INDIAN COUNTRY..

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE INDIANA STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTHS (IDOH) CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL  PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE INDIANA STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND EPA.  THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN LEAD AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE:
IDOH ANTICIPATES CONTINUING INCREASES IN ANNUAL ABATEMENT PROJECT TOTALS, PARTIALLY DUE TO THE RESUMPTION AND FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF LEAD ADVISORY PANEL EFFORTS IN EDUCATION AND OUTREACH.  ADDITIONALLY, CHIP FUNDING WILL CONTINUE THROUGH 2022.  IDOH WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR TRENDS THAT IMPACT THE ABATEMENT PROGRAM AND COMMUNICATE ANY SUCH CHANGES TO THE EPA.  
IDOH HAS AND WILL CONTINUE TO ADVOCATE FOR STATE ADOPTION OF THE RPR PROGRAM AND WILL PURSUE ADDING THIS AUTHORITY DURING FUTURE LEGISLATIVE BUDGET YEARS.
IDOH ANTICIPATES A 100% RENEWAL RATE ON TRAINING COURSE PROVIDER LICENSES.
IDOH WILL PERFORM AN ANNUAL AUDIT IN EACH OF THE 5 LEAD DISCIPLINES (RISK ASSESSOR, INSPECTOR, SUPERVISOR, WORKER, CLEARANCE EXAMINER) FOR EACH OF INDIANA&RSQUOANDS 4 ACTIVE TRAINING COURSE PROVIDERS.
THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE COALITION TO HIRE AND TRAIN AN INSPECTOR WHO WILL BE QUALIFIED TO OBTAIN A FEDERAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY CREDENT

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $469,000 TO THE KENTUCKY ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT CABINET TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF KENTUCKY'S UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM IN LEAK DETECTION, PREVENTION AND RELATED ENFORCEMENT. THE OBJECTIVES OF THE UST PROGRAM ARE: (1) ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR USTS; (2) ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR USTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS; AND (3) DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO CONDUCTING APPROXIMATELY 1,100 FACILITY COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS, PROVIDE COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE TO THE FACILITIES AND CARRY-OUT ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES FOR ANY NON-COMPLIANCE ISSUES DISCOVERED. ANOTHER OUTCOME IS THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY WILL CARRY OUT ITS UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM TO PREVENT THE RELEASE OF REGULATED PRODUCTS FROM USTS INTO THE ENVIRONMENT AND TO ENFORCE VIOLATIONS OF PROGRAM PROVISIONS.  THESE EFFORTS WILL REDUCE RISK, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, AND RESTORE AND SUPPORT RECREATIONAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO HEALTHY ECONOMIES. THESE RESULTS SUPPORT THE EPA'S STRATEGIC PLAN GOAL TO SAFEGUARD AND REVITALIZE COMMUNITIES, AND THE OBJECTIVE TO REDUCE OR PREVENT ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINATION. THE PRIMARY AND DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY'S RESIDENTS.

ACTIVITIES TO BE ACCOMPLISHED IN THIS PROJECT INCLUDE CONDUCTING ON-SITE COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS AT FACILITIES THAT HAVE NOT BEEN INSPECTED IN THREE YEARS, ENSURING THE SECONDARY CONTAINMENT AND UNDER DISPENSER REQUIREMENTS ARE BEING MET, IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DELIVERY PROHIBITION PROGRAM, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE OPERATOR TRAINING PROGRAM. THIS AWARD FULLY FUNDS THE PROJECT.






ACTIVITIES:FUNDING WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT THE ELIGIBLE LUST PREVENTION ACTIVITIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ENERGY POLICY ACT OF 2005. CONNECTICUT WILL MONITOR COMPLIANCE WITH UST REGULATIONS, TAKE APPROPRIATE ENFORCEMENT, IMPLEMENT THE DELIVERY PROHIBITION PROGRAM, IMPLEMENT AN OPERATOR TRAINING PROGRAM, AND PROVIDE A PUBLIC RECORD OF UST PREVENTION AND CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES. THE RECIPIENT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF TRADITIONAL FACILITY COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS AND A FOLLOW-UP ENFORCEMENT PROGRAM.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE (UST) PROGRAM PROTECTS COMMUNITIES LIVING AND WORKING NEAR UST SITES AS WELL AS LAND AND GROUNDWATER RESOURCES FROM CONTAMINATION CAUSED BY RELEASES OF REGULATED SUBSTANCES (TYPICALLY PETROLEUM-BASED MOTOR FUELS AND THEIR ADDITIVES) FROM LEAKING USTS (LUSTS). THROUGH PREVENTION ACTIVITIES, EPA PROTECTS GROUNDWATER FROM THESE PETROLEUM RELEASES AND WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH TRIBAL AND STATE PARTNERS TO HELP MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS TO COMMUNITIES THAT ARE HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED, MARGINALIZED, AND ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY PERSISTENT POVERTY AND INEQUALITY. THE PREVENTION PROGRAM FOCUSES ON BRINGING ALL UST SYSTEMS INTO COMPLIANCE WITH RELEASE DETECTION AND RELEASE PREVENTION REQUIREMENTS AND IMPLEMENTING THE PROVISIONS OF THE ENERGY POLICY ACT (EPACT). THE EPACT REQUIRES ALL REGULATED FACILITIES TO BE INSPECTED AT LEAST ONCE EVERY THREE YEARS. CT DEEP WILL CONDUCT INSPECTIONS TO ENSURE REGULATED ENTITIES COMPLY WITH RELEASE DETECTION, LEAK PREVENTION AND FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, AND ACTIVELY IMPLEMENT OPERATOR TRAINING, PROHIBITING DELIVERY FOR NON-COMPLYING FACILITIES, POSTING PUBLIC RECORDS, AND ENSURING SECONDARY CONTAINMENT OR FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY FOR TANK MANUFACTURERS AND INSTALLERS. CT DEEP WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TOWARDS REDUCING THE NUMBER OF CONFIRMED RELEASES AT UST FACILITIES; AND INCREASE THE PERCENTAGE OF UST FACILITIES THAT ARE IN TECHNICAL COMPLIANCE WITH BOTH RELEASE DETECTION AND RELEASE PREVENTION REQUIREMENTS BY 0.5% OVER THE PREVIOUS YEAR'S TARGET.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE'S DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NH DES) UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM IN LEAK DETECTION, PREVENTION, RELATED ENFORCEMENT, AND FOR MEETING THE PROVISIONS OF THE ENERGY POLICY ACT OF 2005 . THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE: (1) ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS, (2) ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS, AND (3) DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM. THESE OBJECTIVES PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT BY PREVENTING PETROLEUM AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE RELEASES. THIS AWARD PROVIDES LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) TRUST FUND PREVENTION FUNDS TO THE NH DES UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS SUBSECTION IN THE OIL REMEDIATION AND COMPLIANCE BUREAU. ACTIVITIES TO BE ACCOMPLISHED IN THIS PROJECT INCLUDE CONDUCTING ON-SITE COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS AT FACILITIES THAT HAVE NOT BEEN INSPECTED IN THREE YEARS, REVIEWING AND APPROVING NEW UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK AND PIPING DESIGN PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS TO ENSURE THE SYSTEMS ARE COMPLIANT WITH ALL TANK AND PIPING REQUIREMENTS, ENSURING THE SECONDARY CONTAINMENT AND UNDER DISPENSER REQUIREMENTS ARE BEING MET, IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DELIVERY PROHIBITION PROGRAM, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE OPERATOR TRAINING PROGRAM. THIS AWARD FULLY FUNDS THE PROJECT.

ENVIRONMENT BY PREVENTING PETROLEUM AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE RELEASES. THIS AWARD PROVIDES LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) TRUST FUND PREVENTION FUNDS TO THE RI DEM UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS SECTION IN THE OFFICE OF LAND REVITALIZATION AND SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS MANAGEMENT. ACTIVITIES TO BE ACCOMPLISHED IN THIS PROJECT INCLUDE CONDUCTING ON-SITE COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS AT FACILITIES THAT HAVE NOT BEEN INSPECTED IN THREE YEARS, ENSURING THE SECONDARY CONTAINMENT AND UNDER DISPENSER REQUIREMENTS ARE BEING MET, IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DELIVERY PROHIBITION PROGRAM, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE OPERATOR TRAINING PROGRAM. THIS AWARD FULLY FUNDS THE PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:FUNDING WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT THE ELIGIBLE LUST PREVENTION ACTIVITIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ENERGY POLICY ACT OF 2005. RHODE ISLAND WILL MONITOR COMPLIANCE WITH UST REGULATIONS, TAKE APPROPRIATE ENFORCEMENT, IMPLEMENT THE DELIVERY PROHIBITION PROGRAM, IMPLEMENT AN OPERATOR TRAINING PROGRAM, AND PROVIDE A PUBLIC RECORD OF UST PREVENTION AND CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES. THE RECIPIENT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF TRADITIONAL FACILITY COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS AND A FOLLOW-UP ENFORCEMENT PROGRAM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE (UST) PROGRAM PROTECTS COMMUNITIES LIVING AND WORKING NEAR UST SITES AS WELL AS LAND AND GROUNDWATER RESOURCES FROM CONTAMINATION CAUSED BY RELEASES OF REGULATED SUBSTANCES (TYPICALLY PETROLEUM-BASED MOTOR FUELS AND THEIR ADDITIVES) FROM LEAKING USTS (LUSTS). THROUGH PREVENTION ACTIVITIES, EPA PROTECTS GROUNDWATER FROM THESE PETROLEUM RELEASES AND WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH TRIBAL AND STATE PARTNERS TO HELP MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS TO COMMUNITIES THAT ARE HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED, MARGINALIZED, AND ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY PERSISTENT POVERTY AND INEQUALITY. THE PREVENTION PROGRAM FOCUSES ON BRINGING ALL UST SYSTEMS INTO COMPLIANCE WITH RELEASE DETECTION AND RELEASE PREVENTION REQUIREMENTS AND IMPLEMENTING THE PROVISIONS OF THE ENERGY POLICY ACT (EPACT). THE EPACT REQUIRES ALL REGULATED FACILITIES TO BE INSPECTED AT LEAST ONCE EVERY THREE YEARS. RI DEM WILL CONDUCT INSPECTIONS TO ENSURE REGULATED ENTITIES COMPLY WITH RELEASE DETECTION, LEAK PREVENTION AND FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, AND ACTIVELY IMPLEMENT OPERATOR TRAINING, PROHIBITING DELIVERY FOR NON-COMPLYING FACILITIES, POSTING PUBLIC RECORDS, AND ENSURING SECONDARY CONTAINMENT OR FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY FOR TANK MANUFACTURERS AND INSTALLERS. RI DEM WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TOWARDS REDUCING THE NUMBER OF CONFIRMED RELEASES AT UST FACILITIES; AND INCREASE THE PERCENTAGE OF UST FACILITIES THAT ARE IN TECHNICAL COMPLIANCE WITH BOTH RELEASE DETECTION AND RELEASE PREVENTION REQUIREMENTS BY 0.5% OVER THE PREVIOUS YEAR'S TARGET.

THE RECIPIENT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF TRADITIONAL FACILITY COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS AND A FOLLOW-UP ENFORCEMENT PROGRAM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE (UST) PROGRAM PROTECTS COMMUNITIES LIVING AND WORKING NEAR UST SITES AS WELL AS LAND AND GROUNDWATER RESOURCES FROM CONTAMINATION CAUSED BY RELEASES OF REGULATED SUBSTANCES (TYPICALLY PETROLEUM-BASED MOTOR FUELS AND THEIR ADDITIVES) FROM LEAKING USTS (LUSTS). THROUGH PREVENTION ACTIVITIES, EPA PROTECTS GROUNDWATER FROM THESE PETROLEUM RELEASES AND WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH TRIBAL AND STATE PARTNERS TO HELP MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS TO COMMUNITIES THAT ARE HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED, MARGINALIZED, AND ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY PERSISTENT POVERTY AND INEQUALITY. THE PREVENTION PROGRAM FOCUSES ON BRINGING ALL UST SYSTEMS INTO COMPLIANCE WITH RELEASE DETECTION AND RELEASE PREVENTION REQUIREMENTS AND IMPLEMENTING THE PROVISIONS OF THE ENERGY POLICY ACT (EPACT). THE EPACT REQUIRES ALL REGULATED FACILITIES TO BE INSPECTED AT LEAST ONCE EVERY THREE YEARS. CT DEEP WILL CONDUCT INSPECTIONS TO ENSURE REGULATED ENTITIES COMPLY WITH RELEASE DETECTION, LEAK PREVENTION AND FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, AND ACTIVELY IMPLEMENT OPERATOR TRAINING, PROHIBITING DELIVERY FOR NON-COMPLYING FACILITIES, POSTING PUBLIC RECORDS, AND ENSURING SECONDARY CONTAINMENT OR FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY FOR TANK MANUFACTURERS AND INSTALLERS. CT DEEP WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TOWARDS REDUCING THE NUMBER OF CONFIRMED RELEASES AT UST FACILITIES; AND INCREASE THE PERCENTAGE OF UST FACILITIES THAT ARE IN TECHNICAL COMPLIANCE WITH BOTH RELEASE DETECTION AND RELEASE PREVENTION REQUIREMENTS BY 0.5% OVER THE PREVIOUS YEAR'S TARGET.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONTINUED ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA'S UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM. SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE STATE'S LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PREVENTION PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES LEAK DETECTION, PREVENTION, AND RELATED ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES.

THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LUST PREVENTION PROGRAM INCLUDE ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR USTS, ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR USTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH REGULATIONS, AND DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.   
ACTIVITIES:LUST PREVENTION PROGRAMS INCLUDE INSPECTIONS AND OTHER ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES, OPERATOR TRAINING, SECONDARY CONTAINMENT SUPPORT ACTIVITIES, DELIVERY PROHIBITION ACTIVITIES, AND PUBLIC REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. 

SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE: (1) ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR UNDERGROUND STORAGE
TANKS; (2) ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS THROUGH AN INSPECTION
STRATEGY THAT CONDUCTS INSPECTIONS OF ALL UST FACILITIES AT LEAST ONCE EVERY THREE YEARS; (3) IMPLEMENTING AN EFFECTIVE ENFORCEMENT PROGRAM
THAT INCLUDES FOR PUBLIC RECORD SUMMARIES OF INSPECTIONS CONDUCTED, ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS TAKEN, AND PENALTIES ASSESSED; (4) REVIEWING AND
REVISING REGULATIONS FOR SECONDARY CONTAINMENT OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS AS NECESSARY; AND, (5) DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO
OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM. THE RECIPIENT WILL MAINTAIN APPROPRIATE RECORDS TO DEMONSTRATE COMPLIANCE WITH LUST PREVENTION
GRANT AWARD SPECIAL CONDITIONS AND REGULATIONS IN 40CFR PARTS 33, 35 SUBPART A, 2 CFR PART 200, AND PART 1500.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MAINTAINING APPROPRIATE RECORDS TO DEMONSTRATE COMPLIANCE WITH LUST PREVENTION GRANT AWARD SPECIAL CONDITIONS AND REGULATIONS IN 2 CFR PART 200, 2 CFR PART1500, AND 40 CFR PART 35; SUBMITTING PROPOSED STATE UST PROGRAM OPERATING PROCEDURES AND STATUTORY REGULATORY REVISIONS TO THE EPA; PARTICIPATING IN REGIONAL TRAININGS, INSPECTOR WORKSHOPS, AND THE ANNUAL ALL-STATES MEETING; PROVIDING EPA WITH AN OVERVIEW OF OPERATOR TRAINING PROCEDURES AND GUIDELINES.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS THE NUMBER OF INSPECTIONS COMPLETED OF THE TANKS IN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THE RECIPIENT WILL PROVIDE A LIST OF FACILITIES AND LOCATIONS INSPECTED DURING FY 2024 AND VERIFY THAT A COMPLETE ON-SITE INSPECTION WAS PERFORMED AT EACH FACILITY TO AID THE EPA IN PERFORMING RECORD REVIEWS OR AUDITS AS AUTHORIZED BY 2 CFR PART 200.

THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STATE UST PROGRAM AND STATE RESIDENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO'S UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM. SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE STATE'S LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PREVENTION PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES LEAK DETECTION, PREVENTION, AND RELATED ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES.

THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LUST PREVENTION PROGRAM INCLUDE ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR USTS, ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR USTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH REGULATIONS, AND DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.   
ACTIVITIES:THE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PREVENTION PROGRAMS INCLUDE INSPECTIONS AND OTHER ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES, OPERATOR TRAINING, SECONDARY CONTAINMENT SUPPORT ACTIVITIES, DELIVERY PROHIBITION ACTIVITIES, AND PUBLIC REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THE PROGRAM ELEMENTS IN THE 2024 LUST PREVENTION GRANTS PROGRAM ARE THOSE ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT THE STATE'S UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PREVENTION PROGRAM AND TO IMPLEMENT THE ENERGY POLICY ACT.  THOSE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE (1) COORDINATE, REVISE, AND PERFORM ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND STAFF WORK NECESSARY TO ENSURE A COMPREHENSIVE LUST PREVENTION REGULATORY PROGRAM; (2) CONDUCT ONSITE INSPECTIONS OF ALL UST FACILITIES AT LEAST ONCE EVERY THREE YEARS IN ACCORDANCE WITH EPA GRANT GUIDELINES; (3) CONTINUE TO IMPLEMENT AN EFFECTIVE ENFORCEMENT PROGRAM FOR VIOLATIONS OF THE STATE UST REGULATIONS AND TO MAINTAIN PROGRAM INTEGRITY; (4) PRODUCE, MAINTAIN, AND MAKE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC, A RECORD OF REGULATED USTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH EPA GUIDELINES; (5) CONTINUE TO IMPLEMENT SECONDARY CONTAINMENT REQUIREMENTS TO PROTECT GROUNDWATER; (6) HAVE A SYSTEM IN PLACE FOR ENSURING ALL OPERATORS ARE TRAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH UST GRANT GUIDELINES; (7) CONTINUE TO IMPLEMENT THE STATE'S FUEL DELIVERY PROHIBITION REGULATIONS; AND (8) STATE WILL WORK TO INTEGRATE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONSIDERATIONS INTO UST/LUST PROGRAMS AND PROGRAMMATIC DECISIONS. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF ALASKA IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM.  THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE: (1) ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR USTS; (2) ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR USTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS; AND (3) DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.  THESE OBJECTIVES PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT BY PREVENTING PETROLEUM AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE RELEASES.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED ARE AS FOLLOWS: - OVERSEE AND IMPLEMENT THE THIRD PARTY INSPECTION PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES USING A CERTIFIED INSPECTOR AND REQUIRES REGULAR INSPECTIONS OF ALL REGULATED USTS.  ENSURE OWNER/OPERATOR COMPLIANCE WITH STATE UST STATUTES AND REGULATIONS.  CONDUCT UST COMPLIANCE ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES AS NEEDED.
- MAINTAIN THE TANK WORKER CERTIFICATION IN CONJUNCTION WITH DIVISION OF OCCUPATIONAL LICENSING 
- PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE TO TANK OWNERS AND OPERATORS FOR ACTIVE TANKS, CERTIFIED THIRD-PARTY INSPECTORS, AND MEMBERS OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
- TRACK THE LOCATION AND STATUS OF USTS. USE UST ACCESS DATABASE TO TRACK ALL USTS INCLUDING CLOSURES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, INSTALLATIONS, UPGRADES, FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY, AND INSPECTIONS. 
- HANDLE ALL ACTIVITIES RELATED TO PROGRAM MANAGEMENT, ADMINISTRATION AND SUPPORT REQUIRED FOR PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION UNDER THE FEDERAL UST GRANT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE OVERSIGHT OF THE WORK PLAN TASKS, BUDGET PLANNING AND TRACKING, REPORTING TO EPA, ADMINISTRATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THE GRANT ACTIVITIES, STAFF TRAINING, AND PLANNING AND COORDINATION ACTIVITIES WITH THE DIVISION, DEPARTMENT, AND EPA.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:- REVIEW INSPECTION REPORT FORMS FOR ACTIVE UST FACILITIES REQUIRING INSPECTION. TRACK RESULTS IN UST DATABASE (TIMEFRAME - MAY THROUGH SEPTEMBER).  THIS WILL REDUCE THE NUMBER OF TANKS THAT ARE NOT MEETING FEDERAL AND STATE PREVENTION AND PROTECTION STANDARDS FOR USTS.  
-AUDIT 1/3 OR MORE OF THE 14 INSPECTORS AND THEIR TANK INSPECTION REPORTS BY ON-SITE REVIEW TO ENSURE ACCURATE REPRESENTATION OF THE ACTUAL CONDITIONS AT THE SITE AND TO AUDIT THEIR WORK. THE GOAL IS TO AUDIT ALL INSPECTORS OVER A THREE-YEAR PERIOD.  AUDITS WILL ONLY BE DONE IN AND AROUND ANCHORAGE, MAT-SU VALLEY, THE KENAI PENINSULA, FAIRBANKS, AND SOUTHEAST ALASKA AREAS.  
-CONDUCT 30-40 UNANNOUNCED FACILITY 'SPOT CHECK' VISITS BY DEC STAFF TO ASSESS COMPLIANCE AND VERIFY DATA SUBMITTED BY INSPECTORS. SPOT INSPECTIONS WILL BE CONDUCTED IN AND AROUND ANCHORAGE, THE MAT-SU VALLEY, THE KENAI PENINSULA, FAIRBANKS, AND SOUTHEAST ALASKA AREAS.
-ISSUE NEW COMPLIANCE TAG DECALS TO OWNERS FOR ALL TANKS THAT HAVE BEEN INSPECTED AND HAVE PASSED A THIRD-PARTY INSPECTOR REVIEW. ENSURE ALL ISSUED COMPLIANCE TAGS HAVE CURRENT COMPLIANCE DECALS TO ALLOW FUEL DELIVERIES.
-PROVIDE OUTREACH INFORMATION TO CERTIFIED INSPECTORS TO COVER TECHNICAL/REGULATORY ISSUES OF CONCERN. PROVIDE ADDITIONAL INFORMATION TO NEW CANDIDATE INSPECTORS AS NEEDED.  PROVIDE TRAINING SEMINAR/SUMMIT FOR CERTIFIED.  PLANNING A 1 OR 2-DAY SEMINAR FOR MARCH/APRIL 2023 TO BE DELIVERED BY UNIT STAFF OR A CONTRACTED INDUSTRY EXPERT CONSULTANT. ENSURE THAT STAKEHOLDERS HAVE ACCESS TO INFORMATION PERTAINING TO USTS, AND THAT THEY UNDERSTAND THE FEDERAL AND STATE PREVENTION AND PROTECTION STANDARDS FOR USTS. IN ADDITION, OWNERS WILL BETTER UNDERSTAND THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS SET OUT IN FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF ALASKA IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM.  THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE: (1) ENCOURAGING OWNERS AND OPERATORS TO PROPERLY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THEIR USTSAND (2) ENSURING OWNERS AND OPERATORS MONITOR USTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONSAND AND (3) DEVELOPING THE STATE PROGRAM TO OPERATE IN LIEU OF THE FEDERAL PROGRAM.  THESE OBJECTIVES PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT BY PREVENTING PETROLEUM AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE RELEASES.
